special_input: To input any of the Icelandic characters á, ð, é, í, ó, ú, ý, þ, æ, ö, press and hold the appropriate key on the soft keyboard.
which_key_iphone: On iPhone open settings, General, Keyboard, Keyboards, Add new keyboard, then add Icelandic as a language.
which_key_android: On Android, open Settings, System, Language & Input, Languages, then add Icelandic as a language. On the soft keyboard: [Ðð] is the d key, [Þþ] is the t key.
type_word: Type a word, case insensitive, into the input field, use enter in the soft keyboard or touch the ´Leita´ button to submit the search.
single_word_found: If a single word is found, the detail page for the word will be displayed.
more_words: If more than one word form is found for the spelling a list of the results is displayed.
touch_blue: Touch the blue word link to go to the detail page for a word.
switch_set: The 'Leita að beygingarmynd' switch sets headword or any inflectional form matching.
head_search: When 'off' matching within headwords is used.
switch_on: When 'on' matching within any inflectional form is used.
switch_setting: The switch setting is saved between app restarts.
star_matches: Searching with '*' matchs any number of any letter. The result list may contain up to 100 words.
star_example: For example, ´tal*´ matches any word starting  with ´tal´ and ending with any number of any letters.
find_compound: You can easily find compound words using '*'.
star_anywhere: Use '*' anywhere in a word to find compound words.
star_multi: The '*' can be used multiple times, in any position, in any spelling.
helpful_parts: This approach may be helpful in finding words with common parts.
under_match: The '_' (underscore) character matches any single letter.
under_spell: This approach may be helpful if you are unsure of a single letter when spelling a word.
under_position: This '_' can be used multiple times in any position of a word.
under_sure: This approach may be helpful if you are unsure of multiple single letters when spelling a word.
